options.title: -d delim
options.description: Specify a delimiter to be printed between each process ID. The default is a newline. This option can only be used with the pgrep command.

options.title: -f
options.description: Match against full argument lists. The default is to match against process names.

options.title: -G gid
options.description: Restrict matches to processes with a real group ID in the comma-separated list gid.

options.title: -g pgrp
options.description: Restrict matches to processes with a process group ID in the comma-separated list pgrp. The value zero is taken to mean the process group ID of the running pgrep or pkill command.

options.title: -I
options.description: Ask for confirmation before killing a process.

options.title: -l
options.description: Long output. Print the process name in addition to the process ID for each matching process. If used in conjunction with -f, print the process ID and the full argument list for each matching process (pgrep only).

options.title: -n
options.description: Match only the most recently created (newest) process, if any. Cannot be used in conjunction with -o.

options.title: -o
options.description: Match only the least recently created (oldest) process, if any. Cannot be used in conjunction with -n.

options.title: -P ppid
options.description: Restrict matches to processes with a parent process ID in the comma-separated list ppid.

options.title: -q
options.description: Quiet mode. Perform the action, but don't display anything on standard output. Note that -q takes precedence over other display options such as -l.

options.title: -s sid
options.description: Restrict matches to processes with a session ID in the comma-separated list sid. The value zero is taken to mean the session ID of the running pgrep or pkill command.

options.title: -T rtable
options.description: Restrict matches to processes associated with the specified routing tables in the comma-separated list rtable.

options.title: -t tty
options.description: Restrict matches to processes associated with a terminal in the comma-separated list tty. Terminal names may be of the form ‘ttyxx’ or the shortened form ‘xx’. A single dash (‘-’) matches processes not associated with a terminal.

options.title: -U uid
options.description: Restrict matches to processes with a real user ID in the comma-separated list uid.

options.title: -u euid
options.description: Restrict matches to processes with an effective user ID in the comma-separated list euid.

options.title: -v
options.description: Reverse the sense of the matching; display or signal processes that do not match the given criteria.

options.title: -x
options.description: Require an exact match of the process name, or argument list if -f is given. The default is to match any substring.
